previewArticle.title: Sporting Kansas City vs. Toronto FC | MLS Match Preview

recapArticle.title: Sporting Kansas City 4, Toronto FC 1 | MLS Match Recap

timelineItems.desc: Sporting Kansas City take on Toronto FC in a crucial Eastern Conference clash at Sporting Park in Kansas City, Kansas.
timelineItems.title: KICKOFF: Sporting Kansas City vs. Toronto FC | August 16, 2014

timelineItems.desc: Attempt saved. Aurelien Collin denies Toroto FC a goal.
timelineItems.title: SAVE: Aurelien Collin recovers beautifully to deny a clear chance

timelineItems.comment: First Half begins.

timelineItems.name: Toronto FC
timelineItems.text: 1' - Play is underway in Kansas City. TFC in Red, SKC in Blue. #TFCLive

timelineItems.name: Sporting Kansas City
timelineItems.text: And it's GAME ON at @SportingPark! Watch #SKCvTOR on @38TheSpot! http://t.co/CrQRfECgdG

timelineItems.name: biag
timelineItems.text: Game on !!! #TFC #TFClive #allforone http://t.co/K3zJcZrvx9

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 11' Dwyer with a chance, but ends up knocking the ball out of bounds. Bendik steps up for the goal kick. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 10' Henry makes a headed clearance following another Besler throw-in. At the other end, Gilberto makes a mess of a long range shot/cross.

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 11' Sublime touch from Dwyer to bring down Saad's long ball inside the box, but his shot from a tight angle rolls wide.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: 11' Long ball over the top finds Dwyer, but defense collapses and nothing comes of it.

timelineItems.name: Mike McGuire
timelineItems.text: Would love to know what Ashtone Morgan has done for Nelsen to do everything possible not to use him. Play him or move him #tfc

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Jackson.

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 12' Juliao squares up Morrow on the right wing and attempts to cross. It deflects off the young Brazilian and TFC has a throw-in.

timelineItems.desc: Attempt saved. Justin Morrow (Toronto FC) makes a crucial sliding tackle inside of the box.
timelineItems.title: SAVE:  Justin Morrow recovers to thwart goal scoring opportunity

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 13' Sinovic makes his way down the left and wins SKC their first corner of the match. Zusi trots over to take... 0-0 #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Brandon
timelineItems.text: Can we get Julio Cesar for something more than a loan this time around? QPR doesn't do shit with him anyway. #TFC #Cesar

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Sporting looking nothing like the disjointed side that came out v. Vancouver on Sunday.

timelineItems.name: Cass
timelineItems.text: Pass of the Week from Seth Sinovic? Pass of the Week from Seth Sinovic. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: Both teams are playing pretty well tonight. Toronto has had more chances, but Kansas City is dominating the midfield. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Mike Jacobs
timelineItems.text: Interesting stat - 8 of Dom Dwyer's 14 goals for Sporting KC this season have been against Canadian teams (6 vs Montreal, 2 vs Toronto) #SKC

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 13' Bendik comes off his line to punch the ball away, and saves the follow up attempt. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Justin Morrow.
Delay in match Sal Zizzo (Sporting Kansas City) because of an injury.

timelineItems.name: Toronto FC
timelineItems.text: 15' - Justin Morrow makes a goal saving tackle. Huge play. #TFCLive

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 15' Zizzo goes down on the edge of the box. Looks as though it may be an ankle injury. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 15' Good stuff from SKC! Feilhaber squeezes a through ball to Dwyer, and Henry just gets a touch to force a corner. 0-0 #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.desc: Penalty Sporting Kansas City. Benny Feilhaber draws a foul in the penalty area.
timelineItems.title: PENALTY: Benny Feilhaber is taken down in the area

timelineItems.comment: Delay over. They are ready to continue.

timelineItems.desc: Goal!  Sporting Kansas City 1, Toronto FC 0. Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City) converts the penalty with a left footed shot to the top right center.
timelineItems.title: PK GOAL: Dominic Dwyer converts from the spot

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 16' Zizzo was taken down by Morrow during the buildup of that attack. He walks slowly to the sideline as Sapong begins to warm up. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Penalty to Sporting.

timelineItems.name: Sporting Kansas City
timelineItems.text: PENALTY! @b_feilhaber22 is taken down in the box and referee Drew Fischer points to the spot. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.comment: Penalty Sporting Kansas City. Benny Feilhaber draws a foul in the penalty area.
Penalty conceded by Jackson (Toronto FC) after a foul in the penalty area.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Feilhaber brought down by Jackson and ... Dwyer converts for his 15th of the year.

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 17' Dwyer steps up to the spot and launches it into the top of the netting. Sporting KC 1, Toronto FC 0. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Reporting KC
timelineItems.text: Definite penalty. #TFC overaggressive style has finally caught up with them in the 17th. Dwyer makes them pay. 1-0 #SportingKC

timelineItems.name: SoccerScore
timelineItems.text: 17' GOAL Kansas City Wizards! D. Dwyer (Penalty) | Kansas City Wizards - Toronto FC 1 - 0 #SKCvTOR #MLS http://t.co/VKa81P5jwG

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Seth Sinovic (Sporting Kansas City).
Dominic Oduro (Toronto FC) wins a free kick on the right wing.

timelineItems.name: Il Padrino
timelineItems.text: What a garbage call!!! Stupid refs just gifting other teams points against TFC.... #TFC #MLS

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: Honestly need to see the replay on that foul. Seems like a case could be made both ways as to whether or not that was a PK. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Zach Muraca
timelineItems.text: Jackson at RB was a liability for a foul in the box - chops down Dwyer when ball was moving away, tough call but it's a PK for me #TFC

timelineItems.comment: Nick Hagglund (Toronto FC) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City).

timelineItems.name: Ryan Schneider
timelineItems.text: And Ryan Nelsen might start his whining presser at half. #SportingKC #TFC

timelineItems.name: Rahul Vaidyanath
timelineItems.text: really poor judgment by Jackson, Dwyer had lost control of the ball and was going nowhere, inexperience as fullback #SKC #TFC #SKCvTOR #MLS

timelineItems.name: Harita Abraham
timelineItems.text: The title of @Ddwyer14's future biography: I Score When I Want #skc #goal

timelineItems.comment: Attempt blocked. Justin Morrow (Toronto FC) left footed shot from outside the box is blocked. Assisted by Dominic Oduro.
Offside, Sporting Kansas City. Matt Besler tries a through ball, but Dominic Dwyer is caught offside.
Match ends, Sporting Kansas City 4, Toronto FC 1.

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: All business. http://t.co/Dwcs2auiGr #SKCvTOR http://t.co/323dqPcMKw

timelineItems.desc: A battle atop the Eastern Conference between overall league leaders Sporting Kansas City and Toronto FC at Sporting Park.
timelineItems.title: HIGHLIGHTS: Sporting Kansas City vs. Toronto FC | August 16, 2014

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: TFC still have plenty of threats out there. Oduro always dangerous in space on that right flank.

timelineItems.name: Zach Muraca
timelineItems.text: Jackson at back was a liability for a foul in the box - chops down Dwyer when ball was moving away, tough call but it's a PK for me #TFC

timelineItems.comment: Offside, Toronto FC. Jonathan Osorio tries a through ball, but Gilberto is caught offside.

timelineItems.name: Mike Jacobs
timelineItems.text: “@TotalMLS: Jackson fouls Feilhaber in the box. Dwyer converts from the spot to give Sporting a 1-0 lead. #SKCvTOR” #Nostradamus

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Jackson (Toronto FC).
Soony Saad (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick on the left wing.

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 23' Free kick awarded to Sporting KC just outside the box on the left. Feilhaber and Zusi step up to the ball. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Nick Hagglund.

timelineItems.name: Armen Bedakian
timelineItems.text: First question for Nelsen; why play a left winger at right fullback when you have a RB, Bradley Orr, on the bench? #TFC #MLS

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 23' Saad draws a foul on the left wing. Zusi curls it into the six-yard area and Warner heads it out. SKC corner... 1-0 #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.comment: Attempt saved. Aurélien Collin (Sporting Kansas City) header from the right side of the six yard box is saved in the bottom left corner. Assisted by Graham Zusi with a cross.

timelineItems.name: Toronto FC
timelineItems.text: 24' - Great save by Joe Bendik to keep the Reds within one. #TFCLive

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 24' Nearly a second for SKC! Collin headed Zusi's cross on goal, Bendik dove to save and the rebound nearly fell to Dwyer... 1-0 #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.comment: Luke Moore (Toronto FC) wins a free kick in the attacking half.
Foul by Aurélien Collin (Sporting Kansas City).

timelineItems.name: Nate Brinson
timelineItems.text: Skeptical of the penalty live, but replay shows an unnecessary tackle from Jackson. He can't complain about that call. #skcvtor #SportingKC

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Two-point takedown.

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 26' Toronto FC issued a free kick at the half line. They restart play, but the ensuing attempt goes out for a corner kick. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 25' Jackson barges over Saad from behind but no foul given. Toronto on the ball at midfield.

timelineItems.name: Kim Von Ahsen
timelineItems.text: Oduro is picking a fight with PV is is going to lose! #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Toronto FC. Conceded by Seth Sinovic.
Attempt missed. Doneil Henry (Toronto FC) header from the centre of the box is too high. Assisted by Collen Warner with a cross following a corner.

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 28' Osorio loops in a cross from the left flank and Sinovic kicks it out for a corner. Henry's header then sails over the bar. 1-0 #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 28' Toronto FC takes a corner kick, but the header from Warner goes over the bar. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Kristopher Murphy
timelineItems.text: And we’re approximately 65 minutes away from Bradley blaming it on the refs. #SportingKC #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 2' Besler dispossesses Moore at midfield and plays to Zusi, whose through ball for Zizzo is intercepted by Henry.

timelineItems.name: Reporting KC
timelineItems.text: If you think this #SKC match is foggy at the stadium, try watching on TV. Hardly visible.

timelineItems.name: Ken Morris
timelineItems.text: "@CherryPipster: I dunno who ya are fella, but here's your fifteen minutes! #SKC http://t.co/oxC7WIUBAu" looks like @JBBauersfeld back 'ere

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 3' Homegrown keeper Jon Kempin gets his first touches of the match, receiving back passes from centerbacks Collin and Besler.

timelineItems.name: Dan Windler
timelineItems.text: Kempin looking like a young Dolph Lundgreen #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Doneil Henry.

timelineItems.name: Rob Ditta
timelineItems.text: Everytime Jackson tracks back against a winger, I cringe. He should not be playing full back against SKC. #TFC

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Gilberto (Toronto FC).
Aurélien Collin (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Attempt missed. Aurélien Collin (Sporting Kansas City) header from the centre of the box misses to the left. Assisted by Graham Zusi with a cross following a corner.

timelineItems.desc: Penalty! Sporting Kansas City. Dominic Dwyer draws a foul in the penalty area.
timelineItems.title: PENALTY: Dominic Dwyer gets clipped in the box

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 31' Zusi swings in a corner and Collin's header glances wide of the left post. 1-0 #SKCvTPOR

timelineItems.desc: Goal!  Sporting Kansas City 2, Toronto FC 0. Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City) converts the penalty with a left footed shot to the bottom right.
timelineItems.title: PK GOAL: Dominic Dwyer clinical once again from the spot

timelineItems.comment: Penalty conceded by Doneil Henry (Toronto FC) after a foul in the penalty area.
Penalty Sporting Kansas City. Dominic Dwyer draws a foul in the penalty area.

timelineItems.name: Sporting Kansas City
timelineItems.text: ANOTHER PENALTY! This time @Ddwyer14 earns it and he'll also step up to the spot. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 32' Dwyer wins another penalty kick! He's chopped down by Henry inside the box! 1-0 #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 32' Dwyer is tripped in the box, and the ref points to the spot again. This looked more legitimate than the last one, IMHO. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Penaltwo!

timelineItems.name: Michael Taylor
timelineItems.text: Dom Dwyer with another!! LET'S GO SPORTING! #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Sean Maslin
timelineItems.text: PENALTY#2 For SKC ! Oh Toronto, what are you doing? #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: ian brown
timelineItems.text: @Ddwyer14 scores another PK! 33 minutes into the game and @SportingKC leads 2-0. #SKCvTOR #SKC

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 34' Dwyer now has 16 goals in 2014, two within Bradley Wright-Phillips. He has 10 goals against Canadian clubs this year. 2-0 #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Brad de Bekker
timelineItems.text: Refs earning assists now? No business being a part of that play! #tfc #mlsrefs

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: . @Ddwyer14 now has 10 goals vs. Canadian teams this season. #SKCvTOR http://t.co/GmWwpNmGLM

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Soony Saad (Sporting Kansas City).
Nick Hagglund (Toronto FC) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.name: Rahul Vaidyanath
timelineItems.text: #SKC pretty decent value for 2-0 lead - been all over #TFC who have no answer for their pressure; Jackson a massive liability at RB #MLS

timelineItems.comment: Luke Moore (Toronto FC) wins a free kick in the attacking half.
Foul by Aurélien Collin (Sporting Kansas City).

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 38' Sporting KC's central defense is strong as ever. Collin stops Moore from breaking away and shooting. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.comment: Offside, Toronto FC. Michael Bradley tries a through ball, but Doneil Henry is caught offside.

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 38' Bradley lofts a ball over the top for the sliding Moore, who can't prevent it from going out of play. Kempin goal kick. 2-0 #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: D.Jones
timelineItems.text: #tfc a defensive disaster ATM. Still missing two key players it must be reminded. This game is a write off.

timelineItems.name: Alex
timelineItems.text: Michael Bradley in his World Cup form tonight. Awful. #SKCvTOR #SportingKC http://t.co/8EZTl8PZ5D

timelineItems.name: Michael
timelineItems.text: And there's only three clubs. “@MLS: @Ddwyer14 now has 10 goals vs. Canadian teams this season. #SKCvTOR http://t.co/koYDLqPlWe”

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Matt Besler (Sporting Kansas City).
Gilberto (Toronto FC) wins a free kick in the attacking half.

timelineItems.name: Mitchell Tierney
timelineItems.text: Now we see whether or not I can cognitively watch two games of soccer at once. #TFC now kicking off against #SportingKC.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Fischer already waved one guy up for hitting the pitch. Oduro can't like seeing that.

timelineItems.name: Andrew Grumke
timelineItems.text: Amazing game so far...2-0 and it's not even half. can't think of a better way to spend the night with my fiancé. #skc http://t.co/Oow7VuR3VY

timelineItems.name: Mike McGuire
timelineItems.text: You can blame the ref for the ball bouncing off him but its Henry's fault for being too reckless & costing his team another PK #TFC

timelineItems.comment: Attempt blocked. Michael Bradley (Toronto FC) right footed shot from outside the box is blocked.

timelineItems.name: Charles Boehm
timelineItems.text: SKC's pressing makes otherwise ordinary defensive moments into potential disasters for opponents. Punishes the casual & unfocused. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Thomas Butcher
timelineItems.text: These penalties have killed #TFC, But Oduro's hair is glorious! #MLS #SKCvTFC

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Toronto FC. Conceded by Soony Saad.
Attempt blocked. Jonathan Osorio (Toronto FC) right footed shot from outside the box is blocked. Assisted by Nick Hagglund.
Foul by Igor Julião (Sporting Kansas City).
Jonathan Osorio (Toronto FC) wins a free kick in the attacking half.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Another dangerous FK for TFC outside the Sporting area.

timelineItems.comment: Attempt blocked. Michael Bradley (Toronto FC) right footed shot from outside the box is blocked.

timelineItems.name: TNC MLS
timelineItems.text: 43' Free kick for Toronto in a dangerous place. Bradley overlooking it #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 43' This time, Bradley sends it past the wall, but just wide of the goal. It goes out for a TFC corner. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: FK hits the wall, deflected just outside Kempin's post for harmless corner that sails long.

timelineItems.name: Toronto FC
timelineItems.text: 44' - Close call! Bradley's daisy cutter comes inches from pulling one back for the Reds. #TFCLive

timelineItems.desc: Goal!  Sporting Kansas City 2, Toronto FC 1. Gilberto (Toronto FC) right footed shot from very close range to the center of the goal.
timelineItems.title: GOAL: Gilberto with a very clever finish

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: There shouldn't be more than a minute of added time in this half. Hardly any stops in play at all. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: TFC might want to look at signing the pitch invader from Spurs-West Ham to take FKs.

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 45' Strong defending from Collin as the Frenchman performs a clean slide tackle on Osorio down the left wing.

timelineItems.name: Sporting Kansas City
timelineItems.text: Gilberto pulls one back to @torontofc in the fist minute of stoppage time. #SportingKC leads 2-1. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: Gilberto that was pretty. @TorontoFC pull one back: http://t.co/2N7Trq9cgs #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Jc Plante
timelineItems.text: Just call him Goalberto. #TFC

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: Half time here at Sporting Park. The score is SKC 2, TFC 1. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Toronto FC
timelineItems.text: HT in Kansas City - Gilberto gives the Reds life just before the halftime whistle. #TFCLive

timelineItems.comment: First Half ends, Sporting Kansas City 2, Toronto FC 1.

timelineItems.name: Ron Waxman
timelineItems.text: Beautiful goal by Gilberto just before halftime to cut the deficit in half. #SportingKC 2, #TFC 1. #SKCvTOR #MLS #TFCLive

timelineItems.name: Armen Bedakian
timelineItems.text: TFC fans, pray for 2-2. It's not a loss, and it's not as miraculous and statistically difficult as a 3-2 comeback. 2-2 is nice. 2-2 is good.

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 2-1 #SKCvTOR HT stats: Shots (OG): SKC 4 (3), TOR 6 (1) Corners: SKC 4-2 TOR Fouls: SKC 8-5 TOR Passes: SKC 194-176 TOR Poss: SKC 54%

timelineItems.name: Jared Coffman
timelineItems.text: Don't like to give up a goal right before half, loose the momentum. But still have the lead, all that matters right now #SKCvTOR #SportingKC

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: .@SportingKC is 7-0-1 when leading at halftime this season. @torontofc is 0-2-1 when trailing at the break. 2-1 #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: alishia moran
timelineItems.text: @SportingKC looks so much better and back to their dominating selves. Lets go SKC. Keep the second half going strong! @MLS #SKC #MLS

timelineItems.name: Alex Dzierzynski
timelineItems.text: That was a nice goal by Toronto though! #SKC

timelineItems.name: Von Alton
timelineItems.text: “@ENBSports: 4 years and over $200,000 in salaries later Joe Kempin makes his first start. #Homegrown #MLS #SKC #TFCLive” @Jkem2

timelineItems.comment: Second Half begins Sporting Kansas City 2, Toronto FC 1.
Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the attacking half.
Foul by Jackson (Toronto FC).

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: Back underway @SportingPark. Peter Vermes' men lead 2-1 and would move into a tie atop the Supporters' Shield standings with a win. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: Second half has started here at Sporting Park. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Toronto FC
timelineItems.text: 45' - We're back underway for the second half. #TFCLive

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 47' Sporting KC awarded a free kick just outside the box, but the shot form Zusi goes into the wall and out of bounds. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Doneil Henry.

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 48' Zusi steps up to take the corner kick, but Moore clears it. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Nick Hagglund.

timelineItems.name: Alan Hainkel
timelineItems.text: To be quite honest, Drew Fischer isn't having his best night as the center official for #SKCvTOR.

timelineItems.comment: Offside, Sporting Kansas City. Benny Feilhaber tries a through ball, but Dominic Dwyer is caught offside.

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 5' Feilhaber searches for Saad with a long diagonal ball over the top but it's collected by Joe Bendik.

timelineItems.comment: Offside, Toronto FC. Justin Morrow tries a through ball, but Dominic Oduro is caught offside.

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 49' Zusi collects a clever pass from Sinovic, weaves into the box from the left and gets SKC a corner after his cross nearly deflects in!

timelineItems.desc: Attempt saved. Jon Kempin (Sporting Kansas City) makes a big save to stop Gilberto on a breakaway.
timelineItems.title: SAVE: Jon Kempin comes up big to deny Gilberto

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 50' Collin loses the ball just outside the box, but the giveaway is deemed offside. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: A nifty finish from Gilberto to climb within one: http://t.co/43VvxufzGP #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Zach G
timelineItems.text: So GKs can now throw offensive players down by their head/neck? Shit, I wish that rule had been around when I played keeper. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.comment: Attempt saved. Gilberto (Toronto FC) right footed shot from the centre of the box is saved in the bottom left corner. Assisted by Jonathan Osorio.
Corner,  Toronto FC. Conceded by Jon Kempin.

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 51' Gilberto gets a clean breakaway and a great chance for his second of the match, but Jon Kempin steps up big and saves it! #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Toronto FC. Conceded by Dominic Dwyer.
Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Doneil Henry.

timelineItems.name: Andrew G. Haubner
timelineItems.text: That 5 mil or so that TFC spent on Gilberto just saw a brilliant move down the flank turn into a shot straight at the goalkeeper #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Sean Maslin
timelineItems.text: Good save by Kempin and a great run by Gilberto. Really fun match #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.comment: Dominic Oduro (Toronto FC) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Matt Besler (Sporting Kansas City).

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 54' Zusi blows past Henry and Morrow and wins a corner along the right byline. Hearty applause from the @SportingPark crowd. 2-1 #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 55' Oduro and Sinovic continue to battle on the left wing. It almost seems like a fistfight between these two. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City).
Nick Hagglund (Toronto FC) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.name: Andrew G. Haubner
timelineItems.text: Other than flubbing that shot at Kempin, Gilberto has looked fantastic tonight. Back 4 for #TFC ? Not so much #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: Trend continues: TFC relies on long balls, breakaways, SKC relies on set pieces, PKs. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Samantha Baker
timelineItems.text: @Maloun_SKCTID Welcome to the Blue Hell! #SportingKC @KCCauldron #SKCvTOR #MLS #SoccerCapitalofAmerica http://t.co/oUi9seIhfS”

timelineItems.name: Matthew Bonesaw
timelineItems.text: Fear The Bells! #SKC

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: Another festive atmosphere @SportingPark. No team has fewer home losses (one) or fewer home goals conceded (nine) than @SportingKC. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Justin Morrow (Toronto FC) left footed shot from the left side of the box misses to the left. Assisted by Gilberto.

timelineItems.name: Cherry Pip
timelineItems.text: I hope that if Dom sees the goal and has an open shot, he smashes it straight through Michael Bradley. #meow #SKC

timelineItems.name: Luke Lohr
timelineItems.text: Running Golazo for #SKCvTOR - here's hoping it brings as many talking points as last week, eh #SKC fans?

timelineItems.name: biag
timelineItems.text: How bad is Chicago if Montreal won tonight. Should be 3 pts for us next saturday #TFC #TFClive #allforone http://t.co/NDa8wD7Xau

timelineItems.name: Benjermaine
timelineItems.text: #GameTime #SKCvTOR http://t.co/Ocv78lbX93

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: The players march onto the pitch, @SportingKC in their traditional home kit and @torontofc in all red. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Charles Boehm
timelineItems.text: #SKC's pregame show has a plastic pitcher & pint glasses full Coors Light on the pundits' table...Couldn't splurge on a glass pitcher, guys?

timelineItems.name: FLIP
timelineItems.text: Now THAT'S My Kind Of PreGame Show! @CoorsLight #SKC @Ddwyer14 http://t.co/VP0edAdtCG

timelineItems.name: B.A. Floyd
timelineItems.text: Zusi, Besler, and Bradley about to kick off. #SKCvTOR #USMNT

timelineItems.comment: Seth Sinovic (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Dominic Oduro (Toronto FC).

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 5' Oduro attempts to cross from the right byline and Besler does well to lunge out and intercept.

timelineItems.name: Mike McGuire
timelineItems.text: OK #tfc its been a really good day soccer wise #Celtic won the Rags lost the Bitters shit the bed a win vs SKC will be the icing on the cake

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 59' Morrow unleashes one from the left edge of the box and it's well wide of goal. 2-1 #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 59' Morrow takes a shot that goes extremely wide. Look before you shoot, kids. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 58' Zusi flicks a pass downfield for Saad, but Hagglund cuts him off and the visitors take possession.

timelineItems.name: Cherry Pip
timelineItems.text: Oduro got nothin on @ssinovic this game! Seth did his homework. Great job!! #SKC

timelineItems.name: Sporting Kansas City
timelineItems.text: Walk of champions. #SKCvTOR https://t.co/jufUvoLrLc

timelineItems.name: whitecasel
timelineItems.text: No big deal, just a picture with the Sporting CEO Robb Heineman. #SKC

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: About ready to kickoff here at Sporting Park. I'll be live tweeting the game- who you got? #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Mike Carr
timelineItems.text: Kempin stepping in and #SKC doesn't miss a beat, awesome save around 53rd min. #SportingKC #MLS

timelineItems.comment: Soony Saad (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the attacking half.
Foul by Jackson (Toronto FC).

timelineItems.name: TNC MLS
timelineItems.text: 62' Toronto need MB to take over from here if they want to go home with some points here. They desperately need some possession #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.desc: Goal! Sporting Kansas City 3, Toronto FC 1. Soony Saad (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from outside the box to the bottom left corner.
timelineItems.title: GOAL: Soony Saad rifles home from distance

timelineItems.comment: Attempt blocked. Soony Saad (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from outside the box is blocked.

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 62' Free kick awarded to Sporting KC. The shot from Feilhaber is saved by Bendik. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.comment: Attempt blocked. Sal Zizzo (Sporting Kansas City) left footed shot from outside the box is blocked. Assisted by Benny Feilhaber.
Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Jonathan Osorio.

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 62' Free kick to SKC in a central position 35 yards from goal after Saad is tripped. 2-1 #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Archie
timelineItems.text: Bring on DeRo! (before the ref calls a 3rd penalty on #TFC) #tfclive

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Sinovic stepped up to jam Oduro on that last TFC possession. Smart play, kept him out of rhythm without conceding foul.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Saad. Boom. 3-1.

timelineItems.comment: Lineups are announced and players are warming up.

timelineItems.name: Mitchell Tierney
timelineItems.text: 3-1 Saad. That was an excellent finish. Hard to see #TorontoFC coming back now, especially against a side with the quality of #SKC.

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Gilberto (Toronto FC).
Igor Julião (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.name: Yellen's Yodel ™
timelineItems.text: “@SKCgameday: 64' WHAT...A...GOAL!!! @SoonySaad with a sublime half-volley the night before his 22nd birthday! 3-1 #SKCvTOR” BEAUTIFUL!

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Nick Hagglund.

timelineItems.name: Andre Ferguson
timelineItems.text: Brilliant control, turn and shot by Saad...sometimes you just gotta tip your hat #TFC #TFCLive

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 67' SKC with their tails up now. Sinovic races onto the end of Feilhaber's through ball, and his cross is cut out for a corner. 3-1 #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 67' Sal Zizzo goes out, CJ Sapong comes in. With the amount of set pieces this team is getting, Sapong's height will be useful. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Seth Sinovic (Sporting Kansas City).
Dominic Oduro (Toronto FC) wins a free kick in the attacking half.

timelineItems.name: Total MLS
timelineItems.text: Yeah, that's quite a goal from Saad. Can't hit it any better. 3-1 SKC. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: kcbravery
timelineItems.text: Sooooooonyy!!!! #kcbravery #skc #sportingkc #soonysaad #kcpride #soccercapital #sportingpark http://t.co/L7bsWkY5cs

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Gilberto (Toronto FC).
Matt Besler (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.name: Reporting KC
timelineItems.text: Toronto coming out of the gates extremely aggressive #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: Birthday GIFs for @SoonySaad. #SKCvTOR http://t.co/VgbNEMAkbT

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Toronto FC. Conceded by Igor Julião.
Corner,  Toronto FC. Conceded by Aurélien Collin.

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 71' Aurelien Collin keeps coming! What a save to stop Jackson's clear shot. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Luke Lohr
timelineItems.text: TFC's Jackson forgot to soccer. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 73' SUB for SKC: Jorge Claros replaces Benny Feilhaber. One sub remaining for the MLS champions. 3-1 #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: J Felt
timelineItems.text: 3 TFC players alone vs keeper. Not even a shot on goal. One of those nights. #TFC

timelineItems.name: Kurtis Friesen
timelineItems.text: So #TFC is 0/2 on breakaways vs the keeper. Jackson dekes 3 guys outta their pants but fuck man pass it! 3v0 inside the box and no shot?!WTF

timelineItems.comment: Hand ball by C.J. Sapong (Sporting Kansas City).

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: @4totera I think a lot of that is because so many players have meaningful match experience this year.

timelineItems.name: Daniel Ronald Moreno
timelineItems.text: On the other hand, Jackson did a Torres. No excuse after that miss. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.desc: Goal!  Sporting Kansas City 4, Toronto FC 1. C.J. Sapong (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from the right side of the six yard box.
timelineItems.title: GOAL: C.J. Sapong pounces and finishes from close range

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Doneil Henry.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Sapong, and it's 4-1. TFC getting run off the pitch right now.

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 77' And yet ANOTHER corner kick for SKC. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: CJ for four. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City).
Doneil Henry (Toronto FC) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: Zusi's low corner kick flashed across the face of goal, Saad got a slight touch and Sapong slid to bury his 2nd of the season. 4-1 #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Toronto FC
timelineItems.text: #TFClive Sub: In: Dike Out: Moore

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 7' Matt Besler steps up to take a long throw into the box. However, the attempt is knocked out on the opposite side. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.comment: Gilberto (Toronto FC) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Igor Julião (Sporting Kansas City).

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 8' Besler steps up for another long throw. This time, Toronto clears the ball to the center. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 7' Olum flicks Besler's throw to the far right post, and TFC heads out again. Besler will take it again, this time from the right side.

timelineItems.comment: Hand ball by Jonathan Osorio (Toronto FC).

timelineItems.name: Ed Rowe
timelineItems.text: Vermes is intense, clearly has the respect of the clubhouse to turn last week into tonight's performance. #SKC

timelineItems.name: Bryan Schmidt
timelineItems.text: That's how you build the Supporters Shield lead! Dwyer, Saad, Sapong #SKC #DefendTogether

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 80' Dom Dwyer comes off for some random guy named Claudio Bieler. Anyone ever heard of him? #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Ed Rowe
timelineItems.text: That Bieler is still one of our DPs tells How far we've come #SKC

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Not to put too fine a point on it, but shrewd cap management is beating the crap out of the wide-open checkbook tonight.

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Jorge Claros (Sporting Kansas City).
Michael Bradley (Toronto FC) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.name: Daniel Ronald Moreno
timelineItems.text: With 10+ minutes left, Vermes makes his 3rd and last sub putting Bieler on the field. Can we see him score tonight's fifth for #SKC?

timelineItems.comment: Igor Julião (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Daniel Lovitz (Toronto FC).

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: Even though I'm poking fun at Bieler, it is nice to see him get some playing time. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 83' This is the second match @SportingKC has bagged four goals this season. They last did it on April 19 vs Montreal. 4-1 #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.comment: Attempt saved. Bright Dike (Toronto FC) right footed shot from outside the box is saved in the bottom left corner. Assisted by Kyle Bekker.

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 84' SUB for TOR: Kyle Bekker replaces U.S. international Michael Bradley. 4-1 #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Brëtt Miröki
timelineItems.text: GOLAZO!!! Oh wait. That was a shoe? Oh. #TFC

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Bright Dike (Toronto FC).
Aurélien Collin (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the attacking half.

timelineItems.name: Sporting Kansas City
timelineItems.text: Decent night for @Ddwyer14, eh? https://t.co/Mv8zBt28tB

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 83' Michael Bradley leaves the field and Kyle Bekker comes on. Bradley was fairly invisible tonight. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Tea Leaves
timelineItems.text: Something sad hearing adverts for buffalo wings and monster tacos through a British accent #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.comment: Offside, Toronto FC. Gilberto tries a through ball, but Jonathan Osorio is caught offside.

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: Sooooony Saad from distance: http://t.co/dgdosFPF5Q #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Coach1001
timelineItems.text: You know you are having a bad game when you miss with the ball but your cleat goes in the goal :-) #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Ryan Brister
timelineItems.text: Bright Dike takes a shot, the ball is saved, his cleat flies into the net. Good metaphor for #TFC's night.

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Soony Saad (Sporting Kansas City) left footed shot from the left side of the box misses to the left. Assisted by Jorge Claros.

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: Bieler, by the way, makes his first @MLS appearance since May 18. Can @SportingKC score five for the first time in @SportingPark history?

timelineItems.name: Mike McGuire
timelineItems.text: Do #tfc get at least half a goal for Dike's cleat going in the net? #tfc

timelineItems.desc: Attempt missed. Seth Sinovic (Sporting Kansas City) left footed shot from outside the box is close, but misses to the right.
timelineItems.title: CHANCE: Seth Sinovic lets one fly from distance

timelineItems.name: Jough Donakowski
timelineItems.text: I've watched soccer pretty avidly for like 10+ years and that shoe goal is 2nd only to the Liverpool balloon goal in terms of hilarity. #SKC

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 88' Saad fires from a tight angle on the left side of the box and it whistles wide of the near post. 4-1 #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Megan Castellan
timelineItems.text: Tuning in for the end of the #SKCvTOR game. Sadly, that bit where TOR goalie lost his shoe has already happened.

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Seth Sinovic (Sporting Kansas City) left footed shot from outside the box is close, but misses to the right. Assisted by Jorge Claros.

timelineItems.name: Randy Narine
timelineItems.text: #mufc lost today, so obviously #tfc will win, because both of my teams can't be good at the same time.

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 9' Jon Kempin makes his first save of the match! Gilberto gets off a cross to Oduro, but to no avail. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.name: Grace Rogers
timelineItems.text: 2 minutes of stoppage time. #SKCvTOR

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Aurélien Collin (Sporting Kansas City).
Gilberto (Toronto FC) wins a free kick in the attacking half.
Second Half ends, Sporting Kansas City 4, Toronto FC 1.
